metadata.title: USN-4817-1 -- HDF5 vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that HDF5 incorrectly handled certain hdf5 files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4817-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libhdf5-doc - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-dev - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-cpp-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 hdf5-helpers - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-java - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-openmpi-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-mpi-dev - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-mpich-100 - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-jni - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-mpich-dev - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-openmpi-dev - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 hdf5-tools - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 libhdf5-serial-dev - 1.10.0-patch1+docs-4ubuntu0.1~esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
